gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 8,11]]The Pharisees came forward and began to argue with Jesus, seeking from him a sign from heaven to test him.
[[Mc 8,12]]He sighed from the depth of his spirit and said, "Why does this generation seek a sign? Amen, I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation."
[[Mc 8,13]]Then he left them, got into the boat again, and went off to the other shore.

first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 4,1]]The man had relations with his wife Eve, and she conceived and bore Cain, saying, "I have produced a man with the help of the LORD."
[[Gn 4,2]]Next she bore his brother Abel. Abel became a keeper of flocks, and Cain a tiller of the soil.
[[Gn 4,3]]In the course of time Cain brought an offering to the LORD from the fruit of the soil,
[[Gn 4,4]]while Abel, for his part, brought one of the best firstlings of his flock. The LORD looked with favor on Abel and his offering,
[[Gn 4,5]]but on Cain and his offering he did not. Cain greatly resented this and was crestfallen.
[[Gn 4,6]]So the LORD said to Cain: "Why are you so resentful and crestfallen?
[[Gn 4,7]]If you do well, you can hold up your head; but if not, sin is a demon lurking at the door: his urge is toward you, yet you can be his master."
[[Gn 4,8]]Cain said to his brother Abel, "Let us go out in the field." When they were in the field, Cain attacked his brother Abel and killed him.
[[Gn 4,9]]Then the LORD asked Cain, "Where is your brother Abel?" He answered, "I do not know. Am I my brother's keeper?"
[[Gn 4,10]]The LORD then said: "What have you done! Listen: your brother's blood cries out to me from the soil!
[[Gn 4,11]]Therefore you shall be banned from the soil that opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.
[[Gn 4,12]]If you till the soil, it shall no longer give you its produce. You shall become a restless wanderer on the earth."
[[Gn 4,13]]Cain said to the LORD: "My punishment is too great to bear.
[[Gn 4,14]]Since you have now banished me from the soil, and I must avoid your presence and become a restless wanderer on the earth, anyone may kill me at sight."
[[Gn 4,15]]Not so!" the LORD said to him. "If anyone kills Cain, Cain shall be avenged sevenfold." So the LORD put a mark on Cain, lest anyone should kill him at sight.
[[Gn 4,25]]Adam again had relations with his wife, and she gave birth to a son whom she called Seth. "God has granted me more offspring in place of Abel," she said, "because Cain slew him."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 50,1]]God the LORD has spoken and summoned the earth, 
from the rising of the sun to its setting.
[[Ps 50,8]]"Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you, 
for your burnt offerings are before me always.”

[[Ps 50,16b]]"Why do you recite my statutes,
[[Ps 50,16c]]and profess my covenant with your mouth,
[[Ps 50,17]]Though you hate discipline 
and cast my words behind you?"

[[Ps 50,20]]"You sit speaking against your brother; 
against your mother's son you spread rumors.
[[Ps 50,21]]"When you do these things, shall I be deaf to it? 
Or do you think that I am like yourself? 
I will correct you by drawing them up before your eyes.
